item.title: Linda add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Linda add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Linda add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Linda add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Linda add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Linda add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Linda add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Linda add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Linda add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Linda add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Linda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Linda add a quote by J. E. McCulloch
item.description: "No other success can compensate for failure in the home." -- J. E. McCulloch

item.title: Linda add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "A pioneer is not someone who makes her own soap. She is one who takes up her burdens and walks toward the future." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Linda add a quote by Tchaikovsky
item.description: "Inspiration is a guest that does not willingly visit the lazy." -- Tchaikovsky

item.title: Linda add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Linda add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Linda add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Linda add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Linda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Linda add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Linda add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Linda add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Linda add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Linda add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!" -- Dr. Seuss
